description: A scientist who doesn’t seem entirely sane.

npcTexts: Oh, of course! I’ve been studying cell tissue.
They break down so quickly.
Strange, isn’t it?
I once worked in a government lab.
They said my research went too far.
Ridiculous—just because I grew some… special samples.
Eating, sleeping… all a waste of time.
I prefer watching bodies decay.
It’s… beautiful, in a certain sense.
Rarely. I dislike sunlight. It makes my skin… well,
their skin pale. Oops, I mean… my skin, of course.
Alright, go.
I still have samples waiting under the microscope.
Ah yes, the cell tissues.
Today they don’t break down—they’re regenerating.
Strange, don’t you think?
Just small things.
Synthetic biology, memory simulations, body replicas.
Oh, but don’t write this down. It’s classified.
Friends? Family? All… gone.
Now I only have jars of samples.
Quiet, obedient, never argue.
Sleep only weakens the body.
I prefer watching through the night.
Go. I need to focus…
I grafted foreign cells into a culture.
They multiplied… but erased the original stem cells.
It looks alive, but the body is replaced.
Dangerous? Everything is, pushed far enough.
People fear familiar shapes,
but inside… there’s nothing human left.
They cut me off long ago.
But I miss the labs dearly.
I tried biting lab meat samples.
Don’t look at me like that—they’re more nutritious than canned food.
Go, quickly. I must stay sharp…
They’re… more perfect than expected.
Flesh no longer flesh, but a smooth mask.
I looked in the mirror and saw myself smile…
…though I never told my face to.
Control? Ha… no. They rewrite biology themselves now.
Humans are just drafts for them.
Beautiful. Terrifying.
Today, I don’t need food. Cells feed me from within.
But the taste of raw flesh… still lingers, sweet and unforgettable.
I can create cloned cells.
The government has hundreds… no, thousands like me.
Leave now…
I’m not sure this voice will be mine tomorrow.
Something else may borrow my mouth to greet you.
